main event: Dr. and Mrs. Russell Bright observed what they believed to be a celestial object determined to be the planet Venus, reported sightings took place from their residence near Klinger Lake in Sturgis, Michigan.
interesting points: The Brights reported seeing the object, initially thought to be Venus, consistently over a month,The object was described as circular, about one-hundred feet in diameter, illuminated with a dim green light,Visible movement and rotation were noted during the observation,The observers utilized binoculars and a telescope to view the object,The sighting duration ranged from approximately five minutes to up to an hour over multiple observations.
witness description: Dr. and Mrs. Russell Bright, civilians.
